Award.AwardTitle: Partial Support of the Condensed Matter and Materials Research Committee
Award.AbstractNarration:
Non-Technical Abstract:
This project provides partial, 3-year support for the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine’s (National Academies’) Condensed Matter and Materials Research Committee (CMMRC). The CMMRC is a multidisciplinary group, with membership drawn from universities, industry, and government laboratories. It provides expertise to the National Academies and support for the condensed matter and materials research communities. Among the activities that the CMMRC engages in are the organizing of topical workshops on frontier areas of materials/condensed matter research, and the preparation and distribution of written summaries of those proceedings. Through its semi-annual meetings and community outreach, the CMMRC provides opportunities for meaningful engagement among members of the community and the agencies that support research in these fields. Finally, it participates in the development of National Academies’ projects that are of benefit to the condensed matter and materials research communities, and assists in providing long-term stewardship of National Academies’ reports that impact these fields, including the materials research decadal survey.

Technical Abstract:
This project provides partial, 3-year support for the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine’s (“National Academies”) Condensed Matter and Materials Research Committee (CMMRC). The CMMRC is a multidisciplinary group with membership drawn from universities, industry, and government laboratories. The areas of expertise represented on the committee are intended to cover the breadth of the condensed matter and materials research fields.
CMMRC’s roles within the condensed matter and materials research communities are to serve as a conduit for interactions between these communities and the federal government, including the agencies that support this research, and to monitor the health of and important new developments in these fields. Among the mechanisms that CMMRC has used and proposes to continue to use to fulfill its charge are (1) working with sponsoring agencies to initiate and oversee annual workshops that focus on frontier areas of research, and drafting workshop proceedings that summarize the presentations and ensuing discussions; (2) working within the National Academies to develop other special forums such as meetings of experts, and report-generating studies that relate to condensed matter and materials research, where needed; (3) conducting two face-to-face meetings each year that permit engagement among members of the condensed matter and materials research communities and representatives of agencies that support these fields; (4) providing long-term stewardship of reports that CMMRC helped to develop and/or that impact the condensed matter and materials research communities; (5) interacting with the professional societies and FACA committees for condensed matter and materials research; and (6) serving as a resource and providing expert advice to other standing committees and boards in the development of National Academies’ activities that impact the condensed matter and materials research fields.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Condensed Matter and Materials Research Committee (CMMRC) is an active standing committee of the National Academies Board on Physics and Astronomy (BPA). It is charged with assisting the BPA in achieving its goals—monitoring the health of fields within its purview, identifying critical new developments at the scientific forefronts, fostering interactions with other fields, strengthening connections to technology, facilitating effective service to the nation, and enhancing education in physics. The CMMRC seeks emerging and exciting topics in CMMR technical areas for its annual topical workshop. Additionally, the committee looks to identify topics from technical domains adjacent to CMMR—such as biophysics and atomic, molecular, and optical physics—and consider how the committee might better interface with the scientific community and broaden its impact. The CMMRC typically holds two types of meetings. One is held in Washington, D.C to meet with sponsoring agency representatives. Such an opportunity is important to disseminate and exchange information, hear updates about agency programs, and gather feedback on recent CMMRC workshops. CMMRC also uses these meetings to identify emerging topics. The CMMRC also holds second meeting each year, which may be held in Washington, D.C. or at the Academies Beckman Center in Irvine, CA. This second meeting is focused on the development and vetting of emerging topics for future workshops.

 

The CMMRC’s current primary function is to identify and highlight areas of potential CMMR research through its on-going annual workshop series. The CMMRC also plays an important role in developing study proposals, initiating studies, and providing long-term stewardship for reports produced from those studies. Additionally, the CMMRC serves as a repository of knowledge at the National Academies for the condensed matter and materials research fields. During a typical reporting period, its members may provide input to boards such as the BPA in developing proposals and initiating studies that impact condensed matter and materials research. Workshops hosted by the CMMRC and studies developed (and later stewarded) by the committee often explicitly link basic research to broader societal interests. Workshops have had potential for societal impact ranging from security to sustainability, and workshops under development continue a similar breadth.

 

From the period 2021 to April 2024, CMMRC conducted and authored the following workshops:

  • NASEM (2021): Frontiers in Memristive Materials for Neuromorphic Processing Applications: Proceedings of a Workshop 
  • NASEM (2022): Frontiers in Synthetic Moiré Quantum Matter: Proceedings of a Workshop  
  • NASEM (2023): Frontiers in Data Analytics and Monitoring Tools for Extreme Materials: Proceedings of a Workshop

The Academies has also approved work on the CMMRC’s next public workshop, tentatively titled Frontiers in Quantum Coherent Networks: A Workshop. The workshop is planned for fall 2024. The direct URL for the CMMRC website is https://www.nationalacademies.org/CMMRC. All workshop information and reports can be found on the CMMRC website and are available for download in pdf format.
